articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop Meets New Secretary of People's Bureau of Libya
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop Meets New Secretary of People's Bureau of Libya 
    Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and conversed with Bashir Ramadan Khalifa Abu Janah, secretary of the People's Bureau of Libya to the DPRK, who paid a courtesy call on him, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on May 25.

articles.title: Friendly Gathering with Members of Bulgarian Embassy Held
articles.content:
Friendly Gathering with Members of Bulgarian Embassy Held 
    Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- The DPRK-Bulgaria Friendship Association hosted a friendly meeting with staff members of the Bulgarian embassy here at Moranbong Middle School No. 1 on May 25 on the occasion of the Day of Bulgarian Culture and Slav Letters.
 Present there on invitation were Georgi Yanchev, charge d'affaires a.i. of the Bulgarian embassy, and its staff members.    
 The participants looked round various educational facilities of the school, enjoyed an art performance given by schoolchildren and conversed with one another about the need to develop the cooperation in the field of culture between the two countries, deepening their friendly feelings.

articles.title: Local HQ of Preparatory Committee for Joint Functions Formed in S. Korea
Demonstration for U.S. Drop of Its Hostile Policy toward North Staged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Demonstration for U.S. Drop of Its Hostile Policy toward North Staged in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- The Reunification Solidarity and the People's Solidarity of south Korea reportedly staged one-by-one demonstration in front of the U.S. Embassy in Seoul from May 23 in demand of the U.S. cancellation of its war scenario against the Korean Peninsula and its hostile policy toward the north.
 That day Han Sang Ryol, permanent representative chairman  of the Reunification Solidarity, was the first to stage the  demonstration, holding slogans "U.S., drop its hostile policy toward the north and come out for north-U.S. dialogue" and "U.S., give up its plan for preemptive attack upon the north". He demanded the U.S. renounce its hostile policy toward the north, sincerely recognize the DPRK as a sovereign state and come out for direct dialogue with it.
 Braving the police obstruction during the demonstration, its participants did not move to other place but continued it in front of the U.S. embassy.    
 The organizations declared that they would expand the new successes made in the anti-U.S. struggle including commemorations of the 25th anniversary of the May 18 Kwangju Popular Uprising, which opened a chapter in the mass struggle, through the one-by-one demonstration till June 11 when an anti-U.S., anti-war candlelight march is expected to take place.

Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Equatorial Guinean Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Equatorial Guinean Ambassador 
    Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Equatorial Guinean Ambassador e. p. to the DPRK Narciso Ntugu Abeso Oyana at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 On hand was Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Choe Su Hon.    
 After receiving credentials from the ambassador, the president had a talk with him.

articles.title: SPA Vice-President Meets Chinese Delegation
articles.content:
SPA Vice-President Meets Chinese Delegation
    Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met and had a talk with the delegation of the Chinese People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries headed by Wang Yunze, vice-president of the association, in a friendly atmosphere at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 Present there were Jon Hyon Chan, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Wu Donghe.

Gift to Kim Jong Il from Equatorial Guinean President
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Equatorial Guinean President
    Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by Equatorial Guinean President Obiang Nguema Mbasogo.
 The gift was conveyed to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, by new Equatorial Guinean Ambassador e. p. to the DPRK Narciso Ntugu Abeso Oyana today.
